alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion County through 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Moss Bluff, or 8 miles south of Lynne, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Juniper Springs, Weirsdale and Moss Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
